name: Rogue Build for SoU HotU, maybe some other module after that.
author: Pitoni

posts.author: Pitoni
posts.content:
Hello everyone, long time reader, first time posting.

I am looking for a viable solo rogue build, it can have splashes of other classes and prestiges. But, I would like t to be able to open locks, disarm traps, and handle myself in combat.
I am not a big fan of setting traps, but I now it is a very important aspect to soloing rogues.
I prefer Elfs for the auto search, but that is not something I can`t live without.

Thanks in advance.

posts.content:

You could probably use them for something else if you don't mind that.

posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: And as per usual Empyre's style it also has (45!) Lore so you don't have to run into the shops to ID your loot.

You could probably use them for something else if you don't mind that.
How much do you think is enough?

It's not about how much i think it is enough because with the monty haul campaign that HoTU is you actually need almost that much...

Better question would be, how many ranks do i have left over, after i max out "Set Traps"?

Edit: That's only relevant if you care to invest that much into Traps and all, or some other skill of your choice.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
To better answer your question a modified Lore skill of (35) will allow you to ID all those (+8) weapons that HoTU has but will leave out anything that costs over a million gp.

With a modified Lore skill of (25) you will be able to ID anything that costs 250k gp or less.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: There are items in Sands of Fate that are worth tens of millions. I don't claim that Lore is the most important skill, or even a must-have, but it is really nice to have, at least in single-player. In Sands of Fate, especially in the last chapter, there is often a very long trek to a merchant just to identify something so you can use it. I'm not going to gimp a build just for Lore, but if I can work it in without sacrificing anything, I go for it. Do any of these builds look like they're weakened by taking Lore?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yeah SoF gets really silly near the end of it, giving (+14) items like cookies...
